subject.geographic: On the Rigolet near Natchitoches, La

mods.abstract: Runaway in Jail. WAS committed to the Jail of this Parish, on the 28th November last, a negro man, says his name is JAKE, black complexion, about 5 feet 8 inches high, aged about 35 years, thin visage, under lip protruding, a scar over the left eye, and also one across the right foot, front teeth sound, four molars missing, says he belongs to one Ed. Cockell, on the Rigolet near Natchitoches, La. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away or he will be dealt with according to law. D.J. READ, Sheriff of Calcasieu. Lake Charles, Calcaseiu, Dec. 14, 1861.--3t.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
